roleset.name: bring to completion, fulfill
roleset.note: ROUND_OUT-V NOTES: This could also take a causative agent (John rounded out his groupwith a group of stooges) but that complicates things enormously, anddoesn't occur anyway. (from round.01-v)

example.name: round_out-v: blah blah blah
example.text: Mr. Brawer's wife, Catherine, and Robert Stroup, Elizabeth's husband, round out the five-member board.
example.arg: Mr. Brawer's wife, Catherine, and Robert Stroup, Elizabeth's husband,

example.name: round_up-v: like a cattle drive
example.text: After the vote, Connecticut Rep. Nancy Johnson rounded up nearly as many signatures on a letter to Mr. Bush urging him not to veto.
example.arg: on a letter to Mr. Bush urging him not to veto

roleset.name: move in or have an arc-shaped path, circuit through a course (e.g. "do rounds")
roleset.note: ROUND-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on Brown (from round.03-v)
ROUND-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. (from round.02-n)

example.name: round-v: actual motion
example.text: It was a district of small factories and loft buildings and occasional tenements , and he could see the police radio car as he rounded the corner and slammed on the brakes .

example.name: round-v: path without motion
example.text: The path rounded the hill and came to a fork.

example.name: round-n: light verb
example.text: Arab League Secretary General Amr Moussa , who is apprehensive of the devil in the details , carried what he had in his bag and tirelessly made the rounds of those involved in the current crisis .
example.arg: Arab League Secretary General Amr Moussa , who is apprehensive of the devil in the details ,
of those involved in the current crisis

roleset.name: (cause to) become round
roleset.note: ROUND-V NOTES: VN class bend-45.2 (from round.04-v)

example.name: round-v: mathematical rounding
example.text: He rounded the result to a final value of 700 stadia per degree.
example.arg: to a final value of 700 stadia per degree.

roleset.name: session, bout, one time through
roleset.note: ROUND-N NOTES: No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from round.01-n)

example.name: round-n: Example with arg 1
example.text: a new round of talks with the country 's leftist rebels
example.arg: of talks with the country 's leftist rebels

example.name: round-n: Example with arg 1 and loc (arg you getting the impression arg 3 is rather rare?)
example.text: This round of violence in the mideast

example.name: round-n: Ok, heres one with arg 2
example.text: The latest round of confrontation over the past 12 weeks between Israelis and Palestinians

example.name: round-n: Slightly different use of tmp
example.text: the 57th round of elections from September 2000.

roleset.name: spherical, circular
roleset.note: ROUND-J NOTES: 'round' and 'rounded' added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from round.01-j)
ROUNDED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file forunification. (from rounded.01-j)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is round

example.name: round-j: arg1
example.text: Eyes : Pupils are equal , round and reactive to light .

example.name: rounded-j
example.text: The abdomen is rounded and soft .
